post.content:
It is “no longer with EA”, supply teases.

A non-EA studio is reportedly increasing a brand fresh Huge name Wars: Knights of the Weak Republic sport.

The rumour comes by process of the B.O.B. The Podcast. Contributor Bespin Bulletin experiences that a brand fresh instalment of the fan-current RPG is in trend, including “it is no longer with EA” and “we will never wager” what studio is taking over the mission.

“Amongst my digging, I heard there could be a Knights of the Weak Republic mission in trend someplace,” Bespin Bulletin stated (thanks, VGC). “I talked to just a few us, and I furthermore discovered that [Bloomberg reporter] Jason Schreier stated that it is no longer with EA, and we will ‘never wager’ who the studio is that is making this sport.”

“I form no longer know if the bounty hunter sport is with them or if it is with Ubisoft,” Bulletin added. “But yeah, EA is engaged on stuff and there could be one more unannounced sport at EA, which I form no longer like any belief what it is far. I form no longer think it is Battlefront 3.”

Abet in Would per chance 2019, it become reported a movie fixed with KOTOR become within the works, and this time final one year, it become rumoured a KOTOR reboot become furthermore underway.

Lucasfilm’s video video games tag re-established itself earlier this month with promise of fresh Huge name Wars video games made by diversified associate companies worship Ubisoft, including some uPComing video games we knew about, and others we form no longer.

Massive Leisure, the Ubisoft-owned developer of Tom Clancy’s The Division, has begun work on a brand fresh launch-world Huge name Wars sport. The mission utilises The Division’s Snowdrop engine and is led by The Division 2 director Julian Gerighty.

The announcement seemingly marked an live to Disney and EA’s grand-trumpeted 10-one year deal of exclusivity for AAA Huge name Wars projects nevertheless when requested about that 10-one year period of settlement, Lucasfilm Games states that just a few EA projects remain within the works.

“We’re ecstatic with our lengthy-standing collaboration with Lucasfilm Games, which is ready to continue for years to return,” an EA spokesperson counseled Gaming Origin at the time.
